reports.suggestion_message:
To solve this problem, you can try the following approaches:


- Some affected dependencies have newer versions available.
You may want to consider updating them to a newer version to see if the issue has been fixed.

uint v0.5.0 has the following newer versions available: 0.6.0, 0.6.1, 0.7.0, 0.7.1, 0.8.0, 0.8.1, 0.8.2, 0.8.3, 0.8.4, 0.8.5, 0.9.0, 0.9.1, 0.9.2, 0.9.3, 0.9.4, 0.9.5


- If the issue is not solved by updating the dependencies, a fix has to be
implemented by those dependencies. You can help with that by notifying the
maintainers of this problem (e.g. by creating a bug report) or by proposing a
fix to the maintainers (e.g. by creating a pull request):

  - uint@0.5.0
  - Repository: https://github.com/paritytech/parity-common
  - Detailed warning command: `cargo report future-incompatibilities --id 1 --package uint@0.5.0`

- If waiting for an upstream fix is not an option, you can use the `[patch]`
section in `Cargo.toml` to use your own version of the dependency. For more
information, see:
https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/overriding-dependencies.html#the-patch-section

per_package.uint@0.5.0:
The package `uint v0.5.0` currently triggers the following future incompatibility lints:
> [0m[1m[38;5;11mwarning[0m[0m[1m[38;5;15m: trailing semicolon in macro used in expression position[0m
> [0m   [0m[0m[1m[38;5;14m--> [0m[0mC:\Users\Lenovo\.cargo\registry\src\index.crates.io-6f17d22bba15001f\uint-0.5.0\src\uint.rs:157:71[0m
> [0m    [0m[0m[1m[38;5;14m|[0m

> [0m    [0m[0m[1m[38;5;14m|[0m[0m                                                                             [0m[0m[1m[38;5;11m^[0m
> [0m    [0m[0m[1m[38;5;14m|[0m
> [0m   [0m[0m[1m[38;5;14m::: [0m[0mC:\Users\Lenovo\.cargo\registry\src\index.crates.io-6f17d22bba15001f\uint-0.5.0\src\lib.rs:41:2[0m
> [0m    [0m[0m[1m[38;5;14m|[0m
> [0m[1m[38;5;14m41[0m[0m  [0m[0m[1m[38;5;14m|[0m[0m [0m[0m    construct_uint!(U256, 4);[0m
> [0m    [0m[0m[1m[38;5;14m|[0m[0m     [0m[0m[1m[38;5;14m------------------------[0m[0m [0m[0m[1m[38;5;14min this macro invocation[0m
> [0m    [0m[0m[1m[38;5;14m|[0m
> [0m    [0m[0m[1m[38;5;14m= [0m[0m[1m[38;5;15mwarning[0m[0m: this was previously accepted by the compiler but is being phased out; it will become a hard error in a future release![0m
> [0m    [0m[0m[1m[38;5;14m= [0m[0m[1m[38;5;15mnote[0m[0m: for more information, see issue #79813 <https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/79813>[0m
> [0m    [0m[0m[1m[38;5;14m= [0m[0m[1m[38;5;15mnote[0m[0m: macro invocations at the end of a block are treated as expressions[0m
> [0m    [0m[0m[1m[38;5;14m= [0m[0m[1m[38;5;15mnote[0m[0m: to ignore the value produced by the macro, add a semicolon after the invocation of `uint_full_mul_reg`[0m
> [0m    [0m[0m[1m[38;5;14m= [0m[0m[1m[38;5;15mnote[0m[0m: this warning originates in the macro `uint_full_mul_reg` which comes from the expansion of the macro `construct_uint` (in Nightly builds, run with -Z macro-backtrace for more info)[0m
>

> [0m   [0m[0m[1m[38;5;14m--> [0m[0mC:\Users\Lenovo\.cargo\registry\src\index.crates.io-6f17d22bba15001f\uint-0.5.0\src\uint.rs:154:76[0m
